bill.title: House Substitute for SB 128 by Committee on Judiciary – Courts; attorney licensure; selection and appointment of judges and justices; supreme court nominating commission and district judicial nominating commissions; applicability of open meetings act and open records act.
bill.description: House Substitute for SB 128 by Committee on Judiciary – Courts; attorney licensure; selection and appointment of judges and justices; supreme court nominating commission and district judicial nominating commissions; applicability of open meetings act and open records act.

history.action: Senate Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Corrections and Juvenile Justice
Senate Hearing: Thursday, February 12, 2015, 9:30 AM Room 118-N
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by Committee on Corrections and Juvenile Justice
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Received and Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Judiciary
House Hearing: Monday, March 16, 2015, 3:30 PM Room 112N
House Committee Report recommending substitute bill be passed by Committee on Ethics and Elections
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted recommending substitute bill be passed
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Carmichael
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Carmichael was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Substitute bill be passed as amended
House Final Action - Substitute passed as amended;  Yea: 108 Nay: 14
Senate Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Senator King , Senator Smith and Senator Haley as conferees
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Barker,  Representative Macheers and  Representative Carmichael appointed as conferees
House Conference committee report now available
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Barker,  Representative Macheers and  Representative Carmichael appointed as second conferees
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator King,  Senator Smith and  Senator Haley appointed as second conferees
House Conference committee report now available
House Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Yea: 56 Nay: 57
House Motion to Reconsider Adopted
House Conference Committee Report not adopted;  Representative Barker,  Representative Macheers and  Representative Carmichael appointed as third conferees
Senate Motion to accede adopted;  Senator King,  Senator Smith and  Senator Haley appointed as third conferees
House Conference committee report now available
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 72 Nay: 50
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 35 Nay: 3
Senate Enrolled and presented to Governor on Monday, May 09, 2016
Senate Approved by Governor on Monday, May 16 , 2016

votes.desc: Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 40 Nay: 0
House Final Action - Substitute passed as amended - Yea: 108 Nay: 14
House Conference Committee Report not adopted - Yea: 56 Nay: 57
House Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 72 Nay: 50
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted - Yea: 35 Nay: 3

calendar.description: Senate Corrections and Juvenile Justice Hearing
